intro: Xanthosoma hastatum, commonly known as the arrowleaf elephant ear, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces striking spatulate inflorescences with bright yellow spadices, which are typical of the genus Xanthosoma. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant is also valued for its edible leaves, which are used in traditional cuisines.
